issue.title: derive package not accessible via api.at(...)
issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

<!---

REQUIRED:

Classify the type of report your are submitting

-->

  - [x] Bug report
  - [x] Feature request
  - [ ] Support request
  - [ ] Other

I am not sure whether this is by design or indeed a bug.

* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**

<!---

REQUIRED:

If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen. If you're
suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work.

-->

I would like to query all democracy locks for a given account at a given block.

The api-derive package has a perfect function for this: 
`const userLocks = await api.derive.democracy.locks(vote.accountId)`

Currently it seems impossible to combine the above call with a blockApi:

```
const blockApi = await api.at(blockHash)
const userLocks = await blockApi.derive.democracy.locks(vote.accountId)
```

The above does not work as blockApi.derive is not defined. This is because the returned type of api.at() is **not** ApiPromise.

* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**

<!---

OPTIONAL:

Suggest a motivation for the request or ideas how to implement the
addition or change

-->

Currently there seems to be no way to make use of the derive package through a blockApi. I am curious whether this has a technical reason and is indeed by design or a use-case merely has not come up yet until now that would justify the integration.


* **Please tell us about your environment:**

<!---

REQUIRED:

Include as many relevant details about the environment in which you
experienced the issue. Also ensure that you have tested against the
latest stable releases if you believe this to be a bug

-->

  - Version:
  - Environment:

    - [x] Node.js
    - [ ] Browser
    - [ ] Other (limited support for other environments)

  - Language:

    - [ ] JavaScript
    - [x] TypeScript (include tsc --version)
    - [ ] Other

comment.body: This won’t be added. The derives only work on current state - basically to do this would mean to redo everything to do queries at a specific block.

issue.title: Camera Scan for Polkadot Identicon on React Native
issue.body:
Hi,

I am looking for a way to create a scanner for the react-native identicon. Is there a white paper somewhere to explain how is generated the identicon from address in order to develop it on my own ? I will then make a pull request for you to enjoy this feature because I am sure it could be a nice feature for all react native developers.

Best Regards,

Victor

comment.body:
The code for the icon generation is here - https://github.com/polkadot-js/ui/blob/master/packages/ui-shared/src/icons/polkadot.ts

(As you can see in the comments, there is no "white paper", rather just an original canonical implementation that is linked to)

You won't be able to go from icon -> address, the issue is that the ]publicKey gets hashed with blake2_512](https://github.com/polkadot-js/ui/blob/fdf756d56bd0917053b610ad94e1c968858cd55c/packages/ui-shared/src/icons/polkadot.ts#L106), so that is a non-reversible/one-way operation.

issue.title: Support on UI for Option <customType>

labels.name: <duplicate>
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

<!---

REQUIRED:

Classify the type of report your are submitting

-->

  - [x] Bug report
  - [x] Feature request


* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**
Current behaviour: Polkadot Apps UI doesn't support custom types, like `Option <BoundedString>` so due that, we can't submit extrinsics using Extrinsics, because it think there is some file to upload, once it is just custom type `<BoundedString>`. It works if this is not Option (look at palletName), but if its Option => after toggling "file upload" and entering text, the `Submit Transaction` button is greyed out and can't submit extrinsic.

The `BoundedString` is just `BoundedVec<u8, MAX_LENGTH>`.  It only accepts the exact bounded vector's length, no more no less

![Screenshot 2022-10-14 at 10 21 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48051231/195798683-ce35b638-338c-43f6-90ac-71db93869faa.png)

<!---

REQUIRED:

If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen. If you're
suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work.

-->


* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**

It would be great to have support for Options so the UI would display nicely and we could actually use it properly. Right now we need to use JS console if there is any custom type wrapped into Option.

<!---

OPTIONAL:

Suggest a motivation for the request or ideas how to implement the
addition or change

-->

<!---

REQUIRED:

Include as many relevant details about the environment in which you
experienced the issue. Also ensure that you have tested against the
latest stable releases if you believe this to be a bug

-->

  - Version:
Parity Polkadot v0.9.29
api v9.5.1
apps v0.121.2-102-x
  - Environment:
    - [x] Browsers
     - Chrome, Firefox

issue.title: React Native: undefined is not a function (near '...window.addEventListener…')
issue.body:
![Simulator Screen Shot - iPhone 14 - 2022-11-04 at 12 28 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4160142/199887679-00b2c82d-29c0-4d64-aafa-9220ad466cac.png)

Hi, I tried updating my Polkadot JS libraries but after updating to the latest, I'm getting this error as above when running on React Native iOS.

My package.json has:

```
    "@polkadot/api": "^9.6.2",
    "@polkadot/extension-chains": "^0.44.6",
    "@polkadot/extension-inject": "^0.44.6",
    "@polkadot/keyring": "^10.1.11",
    "@polkadot/util": "^10.1.11",
    "@polkadot/util-crypto": "^10.1.11",
    "@polkadot/wasm-crypto": "^6.3.1",
```

Previously this configuration worked for me:

```
    "@polkadot/api": "~8.13.1",
    "@polkadot/extension-chains": "^0.44.3",
    "@polkadot/extension-inject": "^0.44.3",
    "@polkadot/keyring": "^10.1.2",
    "@polkadot/util": "^10.1.2",
    "@polkadot/util-crypto": "^10.1.2",
    "@polkadot/wasm-crypto": "^6.3.1",
```

The error seems to suggest that the library is trying to make function calls that are only available on the browser. I'm assuming this could be something that was added in `@polkadot/api` v9?

Assistance is much appreciated, thanks!

comment.body: It would actually seem that it doesn't like the use of `require` in this context, judging by the line & `undefined is not a function`.

comment.body:
Currently the JS tab does not actually deal with the extensions. The issue is that the JS there runs in a completely different context, so it doesn't hook into the main UI.

On dev nodes (and only dev nodes), the keyring is injected, so you can use that, however for production/testing/etc. chains there are no hooks to the main sending functionality. (Doing so would mean that you can send unsuspecting users snippets to execute that would transfer funds)

issue.title: feature request: multi-call function in polkadot.js api by default
issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

<!---

REQUIRED:

Classify the type of report your are submitting

-->

  - [ ] Bug report
  - [x] Feature request
  - [ ] Support request
  - [ ] Other


* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**
  - as far as I know, `api.queryMulti` doesn't support smart-contract interaction.
  - it should be available also with smart contract interaction 

for example, expected behavior would be something like 
```js
const aliceAddress = 'zxx...'
calls = [{
  address: 'zzz....', // contract address which has balanceOf function
  functionName: 'balanceOf',
  args: [aliceAddress]
},
{
  address: 'zxy....', // another contract address which has balanceOf function
  functionName: 'balanceOf',
  args: [aliceAddress]
}
]
const result = await api.queryMulti(calls)
console.log(result) // display the balances of zzz... and zxy.. token
```
c.f: https://github.com/makerdao/multicall

<!---

REQUIRED:

If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen. If you're
suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work.

-->


* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**
  - because most of the multicall would be made with smart contract, it should be supported

<!---

OPTIONAL:

Suggest a motivation for the request or ideas how to implement the
addition or change

-->

comment.body:
It is either -

- custom logic (not mapping to RPCs)
- doing it on the contracts layer (which is what your linked repo does on Ethereum)

It can only go into api-contracts and in all cases it would need to know the ABIs to make actual calls for option 1 (in the case of state, the metadata supplies all interfaces and multi-RPCs, so it can be a single step). Obviously your linked source uses the second option, since you have exactly the same ABI/RPC related issues elsewhere on contract platforms.

issue.title: How to add custom derives?
issue.body:
I was browsing in the codebase, but I could not get a full picture of what one is supposed to do if they want to provide custom derives to their api-augmented object. Documentation is very poor, and everything seems to be so "runtimey" and flexible that it's hard to look at and replicated.
Our use case is the following: given some sort of ID, we want to 1. perform a query to fetch some details, 2. use the information about the block number returned from the query to perform an` api.derive.getBlockByNumber` call, and then retrieve some info from the block and return it from the user.

This ideally would be solved with a `api.derive.credential.fetchById()`, which does all I mentioned above. Otherwise, one has to do `api.query.credentials.fetch()`, and then some more logic that, in the end, calls `api.derive.getBlockByNumber`.

Is there a way to get support in what we want to do?

comment.body:
https://github.com/polkadot-js/api/issues

I would not expect a speedy resolution (unless somebody submits a PR), but at least it gets it into the queue to be done at "some point in the future".

None at all. 

PRs are welcome for [additions/support](https://github.com/polkadot-js/api/tree/master/packages/typegen) if this would be useful. (Alternatively you can log it as an request to get it in the queue)

issue.body:
I was browsing in the codebase, but I could not get a full picture of what one is supposed to do if they want to provide custom derives to their api-augmented object. Documentation is very poor, and everything seems to be so "runtimey" and flexible that it's hard to look at and replicated.

comment.body:
Internally the API uses rxjs, and this then gets exposed both rxjs and promise variants of the API. Since derives are "internal interfaces" it fits into the same process, creating them exposes them on all type of APIs.

There is no augmentation for derives.

pull_request.title: Member Request
pull_request.body:
My name is Davide and I started working on the Polkadot ecosystem almost one year ago.

I'm mostly passionate about working on low level system components,
with main focus on applied cryptography and distributed computing.

Since I started working on Substrate and Polkadot my main tasks are more or less related to the consensus protocols components.

---

Worth mentioning contributions to the ecosystem so far:
- https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/pull/2352  - support for ECDSA identities in Rust libp2p implementation
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/10798 - integration of a bit faster secp256k1 ECDSA implementation
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11022 - revert Babe's consensus data on CLI revert command
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11162 - revert Grandpa's consensus data on CLI revert command
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/10748 - remove obsolete Babe's block weight data
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11228 - Mostly a simplification and recursive to iterative rewrite of a fairly important data structure used to keep track of epoch data by both Babe and Grandpa (and next Sassafras).
- https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/5350 - Polkadot chain selection subsystem data revert
- https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/5438 - Polkadot approval voting subsystem data revert

---

But mostly, I use my time to work on Sassafras protocol implementation:
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11678
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11889
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/12314
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11879 - Main PR (still open - WiP)
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/11515 - Main tracking issue

---

Beside that, my daily job is to actively work on the Substrate framework so other, not really worth mentioning, minor contribution pops-up from time to time

---

I apply for **I Dan**

issue.title: derive package not accessible via api.at(...)
issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

<!---

REQUIRED:

Classify the type of report your are submitting

-->

  - [x] Bug report
  - [x] Feature request
  - [ ] Support request
  - [ ] Other

I am not sure whether this is by design or indeed a bug.

* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**

<!---

REQUIRED:

If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen. If you're
suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work.

-->

I would like to query all democracy locks for a given account at a given block.

The api-derive package has a perfect function for this: 
`const userLocks = await api.derive.democracy.locks(vote.accountId)`

Currently it seems impossible to combine the above call with a blockApi:

```
const blockApi = await api.at(blockHash)
const userLocks = await blockApi.derive.democracy.locks(vote.accountId)
```

The above does not work as blockApi.derive is not defined. This is because the returned type of api.at() is **not** ApiPromise.

* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**

<!---

OPTIONAL:

Suggest a motivation for the request or ideas how to implement the
addition or change

-->

Currently there seems to be no way to make use of the derive package through a blockApi. I am curious whether this has a technical reason and is indeed by design or a use-case merely has not come up yet until now that would justify the integration.

issue.title: Camera Scan for Polkadot Identicon on React Native
issue.body:
Hi,

I am looking for a way to create a scanner for the react-native identicon. Is there a white paper somewhere to explain how is generated the identicon from address in order to develop it on my own ? I will then make a pull request for you to enjoy this feature because I am sure it could be a nice feature for all react native developers.

Best Regards,

Victor

comment.body:
The code for the icon generation is here - https://github.com/polkadot-js/ui/blob/master/packages/ui-shared/src/icons/polkadot.ts

(As you can see in the comments, there is no "white paper", rather just an original canonical implementation that is linked to)

You won't be able to go from icon -> address, the issue is that the ]publicKey gets hashed with blake2_512](https://github.com/polkadot-js/ui/blob/fdf756d56bd0917053b610ad94e1c968858cd55c/packages/ui-shared/src/icons/polkadot.ts#L106), so that is a non-reversible/one-way operation.

issue.title: Support on UI for Option <customType>

labels.name: <duplicate>
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

<!---

REQUIRED:

Classify the type of report your are submitting

-->

  - [x] Bug report
  - [x] Feature request


* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**
Current behaviour: Polkadot Apps UI doesn't support custom types, like `Option <BoundedString>` so due that, we can't submit extrinsics using Extrinsics, because it think there is some file to upload, once it is just custom type `<BoundedString>`. It works if this is not Option (look at palletName), but if its Option => after toggling "file upload" and entering text, the `Submit Transaction` button is greyed out and can't submit extrinsic.

The `BoundedString` is just `BoundedVec<u8, MAX_LENGTH>`.  It only accepts the exact bounded vector's length, no more no less

![Screenshot 2022-10-14 at 10 21 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48051231/195798683-ce35b638-338c-43f6-90ac-71db93869faa.png)

<!---

REQUIRED:

If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen. If you're
suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work.

-->


* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**

It would be great to have support for Options so the UI would display nicely and we could actually use it properly. Right now we need to use JS console if there is any custom type wrapped into Option.

<!---

OPTIONAL:

Suggest a motivation for the request or ideas how to implement the
addition or change

-->

<!---

REQUIRED:

Include as many relevant details about the environment in which you
experienced the issue. Also ensure that you have tested against the
latest stable releases if you believe this to be a bug

-->

  - Version:
Parity Polkadot v0.9.29
api v9.5.1
apps v0.121.2-102-x
  - Environment:
    - [x] Browsers
     - Chrome, Firefox

issue.title: React Native: undefined is not a function (near '...window.addEventListener…')
issue.body:
![Simulator Screen Shot - iPhone 14 - 2022-11-04 at 12 28 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4160142/199887679-00b2c82d-29c0-4d64-aafa-9220ad466cac.png)

Hi, I tried updating my Polkadot JS libraries but after updating to the latest, I'm getting this error as above when running on React Native iOS.

My package.json has:

```
    "@polkadot/api": "^9.6.2",
    "@polkadot/extension-chains": "^0.44.6",
    "@polkadot/extension-inject": "^0.44.6",
    "@polkadot/keyring": "^10.1.11",
    "@polkadot/util": "^10.1.11",
    "@polkadot/util-crypto": "^10.1.11",
    "@polkadot/wasm-crypto": "^6.3.1",
```

Previously this configuration worked for me:

```
    "@polkadot/api": "~8.13.1",
    "@polkadot/extension-chains": "^0.44.3",
    "@polkadot/extension-inject": "^0.44.3",
    "@polkadot/keyring": "^10.1.2",
    "@polkadot/util": "^10.1.2",
    "@polkadot/util-crypto": "^10.1.2",
    "@polkadot/wasm-crypto": "^6.3.1",
```

The error seems to suggest that the library is trying to make function calls that are only available on the browser. I'm assuming this could be something that was added in `@polkadot/api` v9?

Assistance is much appreciated, thanks!

comment.body: It would actually seem that it doesn't like the use of `require` in this context, judging by the line & `undefined is not a function`.

comment.body:
Currently the JS tab does not actually deal with the extensions. The issue is that the JS there runs in a completely different context, so it doesn't hook into the main UI.

On dev nodes (and only dev nodes), the keyring is injected, so you can use that, however for production/testing/etc. chains there are no hooks to the main sending functionality. (Doing so would mean that you can send unsuspecting users snippets to execute that would transfer funds)

comment.body:
Indeed. So preimages went from hash -> enum. (Affects governance 2, as well as previous versions of democracy, which took a bit of priority).

In this case I should have pushed the fix for the submission already, but things snowballed a bit. (So the preimage submission part works, but not using them - display is actually fine as well)

issue.title: feature request: multi-call function in polkadot.js api by default
issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

<!---

REQUIRED:

Classify the type of report your are submitting

-->

  - [ ] Bug report
  - [x] Feature request
  - [ ] Support request
  - [ ] Other


* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**
  - as far as I know, `api.queryMulti` doesn't support smart-contract interaction.
  - it should be available also with smart contract interaction 

for example, expected behavior would be something like 
```js
const aliceAddress = 'zxx...'
calls = [{
  address: 'zzz....', // contract address which has balanceOf function
  functionName: 'balanceOf',
  args: [aliceAddress]
},
{
  address: 'zxy....', // another contract address which has balanceOf function
  functionName: 'balanceOf',
  args: [aliceAddress]
}
]
const result = await api.queryMulti(calls)
console.log(result) // display the balances of zzz... and zxy.. token
```
c.f: https://github.com/makerdao/multicall

<!---

REQUIRED:

If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen. If you're
suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work.

-->


* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**
  - because most of the multicall would be made with smart contract, it should be supported

<!---

OPTIONAL:

Suggest a motivation for the request or ideas how to implement the
addition or change

-->

comment.body:
It is either -

- custom logic (not mapping to RPCs)
- doing it on the contracts layer (which is what your linked repo does on Ethereum)

It can only go into api-contracts and in all cases it would need to know the ABIs to make actual calls for option 1 (in the case of state, the metadata supplies all interfaces and multi-RPCs, so it can be a single step). Obviously your linked source uses the second option, since you have exactly the same ABI/RPC related issues elsewhere on contract platforms.

issue.title: How to add custom derives?
issue.body:
I was browsing in the codebase, but I could not get a full picture of what one is supposed to do if they want to provide custom derives to their api-augmented object. Documentation is very poor, and everything seems to be so "runtimey" and flexible that it's hard to look at and replicated.
Our use case is the following: given some sort of ID, we want to 1. perform a query to fetch some details, 2. use the information about the block number returned from the query to perform an` api.derive.getBlockByNumber` call, and then retrieve some info from the block and return it from the user.

This ideally would be solved with a `api.derive.credential.fetchById()`, which does all I mentioned above. Otherwise, one has to do `api.query.credentials.fetch()`, and then some more logic that, in the end, calls `api.derive.getBlockByNumber`.

Is there a way to get support in what we want to do?

comment.body:
https://github.com/polkadot-js/api/issues

I would not expect a speedy resolution (unless somebody submits a PR), but at least it gets it into the queue to be done at "some point in the future".

None at all. 

PRs are welcome for [additions/support](https://github.com/polkadot-js/api/tree/master/packages/typegen) if this would be useful. (Alternatively you can log it as an request to get it in the queue)

issue.title: How to add custom derives?
issue.body:
I was browsing in the codebase, but I could not get a full picture of what one is supposed to do if they want to provide custom derives to their api-augmented object. Documentation is very poor, and everything seems to be so "runtimey" and flexible that it's hard to look at and replicated.
Our use case is the following: given some sort of ID, we want to 1. perform a query to fetch some details, 2. use the information about the block number returned from the query to perform an` api.derive.getBlockByNumber` call, and then retrieve some info from the block and return it from the user.

This ideally would be solved with a `api.derive.credential.fetchById()`, which does all I mentioned above. Otherwise, one has to do `api.query.credentials.fetch()`, and then some more logic that, in the end, calls `api.derive.getBlockByNumber`.

Is there a way to get support in what we want to do?

comment.body:
Internally the API uses rxjs, and this then gets exposed both rxjs and promise variants of the API. Since derives are "internal interfaces" it fits into the same process, creating them exposes them on all type of APIs.

There is no augmentation for derives.

pull_request.title: Member Request
pull_request.body:
My name is Davide and I started working on the Polkadot ecosystem almost one year ago.

I'm mostly passionate about working on low level system components,
with main focus on applied cryptography and distributed computing.

Since I started working on Substrate and Polkadot my main tasks are more or less related to the consensus protocols components.

---

Worth mentioning contributions to the ecosystem so far:
- https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/pull/2352  - support for ECDSA identities in Rust libp2p implementation
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/10798 - integration of a bit faster secp256k1 ECDSA implementation
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11022 - revert Babe's consensus data on CLI revert command
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11162 - revert Grandpa's consensus data on CLI revert command
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/10748 - remove obsolete Babe's block weight data
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11228 - Mostly a simplification and recursive to iterative rewrite of a fairly important data structure used to keep track of epoch data by both Babe and Grandpa (and next Sassafras).
- https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/5350 - Polkadot chain selection subsystem data revert
- https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/5438 - Polkadot approval voting subsystem data revert

---

But mostly, I use my time to work on Sassafras protocol implementation:
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11678
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11889
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/12314
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11879 - Main PR (still open - WiP)
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/11515 - Main tracking issue

---

Beside that, my daily job is to actively work on the Substrate framework so other, not really worth mentioning, minor contribution pops-up from time to time

---

I apply for **I Dan**

issue.title: derive package not accessible via api.at(...)
issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

<!---

REQUIRED:

Classify the type of report your are submitting

-->

  - [x] Bug report
  - [x] Feature request
  - [ ] Support request
  - [ ] Other

I am not sure whether this is by design or indeed a bug.

* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**

<!---

REQUIRED:

If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen. If you're
suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work.

-->

I would like to query all democracy locks for a given account at a given block.

The api-derive package has a perfect function for this: 
`const userLocks = await api.derive.democracy.locks(vote.accountId)`

Currently it seems impossible to combine the above call with a blockApi:

```
const blockApi = await api.at(blockHash)
const userLocks = await blockApi.derive.democracy.locks(vote.accountId)
```

The above does not work as blockApi.derive is not defined. This is because the returned type of api.at() is **not** ApiPromise.

* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**

<!---

OPTIONAL:

Suggest a motivation for the request or ideas how to implement the
addition or change

-->

Currently there seems to be no way to make use of the derive package through a blockApi. I am curious whether this has a technical reason and is indeed by design or a use-case merely has not come up yet until now that would justify the integration.


* **Please tell us about your environment:**

<!---

REQUIRED:

Include as many relevant details about the environment in which you
experienced the issue. Also ensure that you have tested against the
latest stable releases if you believe this to be a bug

-->

  - Version:
  - Environment:

    - [x] Node.js
    - [ ] Browser
    - [ ] Other (limited support for other environments)

  - Language:

    - [ ] JavaScript
    - [x] TypeScript (include tsc --version)
    - [ ] Other

comment.body: This won’t be added. The derives only work on current state - basically to do this would mean to redo everything to do queries at a specific block.

issue.title: Camera Scan for Polkadot Identicon on React Native
issue.body:
Hi,

I am looking for a way to create a scanner for the react-native identicon. Is there a white paper somewhere to explain how is generated the identicon from address in order to develop it on my own ? I will then make a pull request for you to enjoy this feature because I am sure it could be a nice feature for all react native developers.

Best Regards,

Victor

comment.body:
The code for the icon generation is here - https://github.com/polkadot-js/ui/blob/master/packages/ui-shared/src/icons/polkadot.ts

(As you can see in the comments, there is no "white paper", rather just an original canonical implementation that is linked to)

You won't be able to go from icon -> address, the issue is that the ]publicKey gets hashed with blake2_512](https://github.com/polkadot-js/ui/blob/fdf756d56bd0917053b610ad94e1c968858cd55c/packages/ui-shared/src/icons/polkadot.ts#L106), so that is a non-reversible/one-way operation.

issue.title: Support on UI for Option <customType>

labels.name: <duplicate>
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

<!---

REQUIRED:

Classify the type of report your are submitting

-->

  - [x] Bug report
  - [x] Feature request


* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**
Current behaviour: Polkadot Apps UI doesn't support custom types, like `Option <BoundedString>` so due that, we can't submit extrinsics using Extrinsics, because it think there is some file to upload, once it is just custom type `<BoundedString>`. It works if this is not Option (look at palletName), but if its Option => after toggling "file upload" and entering text, the `Submit Transaction` button is greyed out and can't submit extrinsic.

The `BoundedString` is just `BoundedVec<u8, MAX_LENGTH>`.  It only accepts the exact bounded vector's length, no more no less

![Screenshot 2022-10-14 at 10 21 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48051231/195798683-ce35b638-338c-43f6-90ac-71db93869faa.png)

<!---

REQUIRED:

If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen. If you're
suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work.

-->


* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**

It would be great to have support for Options so the UI would display nicely and we could actually use it properly. Right now we need to use JS console if there is any custom type wrapped into Option.

<!---

OPTIONAL:

Suggest a motivation for the request or ideas how to implement the
addition or change

-->

<!---

REQUIRED:

Include as many relevant details about the environment in which you
experienced the issue. Also ensure that you have tested against the
latest stable releases if you believe this to be a bug

-->

  - Version:
Parity Polkadot v0.9.29
api v9.5.1
apps v0.121.2-102-x
  - Environment:
    - [x] Browsers
     - Chrome, Firefox

issue.title: React Native: undefined is not a function (near '...window.addEventListener…')
issue.body:
![Simulator Screen Shot - iPhone 14 - 2022-11-04 at 12 28 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4160142/199887679-00b2c82d-29c0-4d64-aafa-9220ad466cac.png)

Hi, I tried updating my Polkadot JS libraries but after updating to the latest, I'm getting this error as above when running on React Native iOS.

My package.json has:

```
    "@polkadot/api": "^9.6.2",
    "@polkadot/extension-chains": "^0.44.6",
    "@polkadot/extension-inject": "^0.44.6",
    "@polkadot/keyring": "^10.1.11",
    "@polkadot/util": "^10.1.11",
    "@polkadot/util-crypto": "^10.1.11",
    "@polkadot/wasm-crypto": "^6.3.1",
```

Previously this configuration worked for me:

```
    "@polkadot/api": "~8.13.1",
    "@polkadot/extension-chains": "^0.44.3",
    "@polkadot/extension-inject": "^0.44.3",
    "@polkadot/keyring": "^10.1.2",
    "@polkadot/util": "^10.1.2",
    "@polkadot/util-crypto": "^10.1.2",
    "@polkadot/wasm-crypto": "^6.3.1",
```

The error seems to suggest that the library is trying to make function calls that are only available on the browser. I'm assuming this could be something that was added in `@polkadot/api` v9?

Assistance is much appreciated, thanks!

comment.body: It would actually seem that it doesn't like the use of `require` in this context, judging by the line & `undefined is not a function`.

issue.title: Error: Unable to authorise transaction (locked key pair)

comment.body:
Currently the JS tab does not actually deal with the extensions. The issue is that the JS there runs in a completely different context, so it doesn't hook into the main UI.

On dev nodes (and only dev nodes), the keyring is injected, so you can use that, however for production/testing/etc. chains there are no hooks to the main sending functionality. (Doing so would mean that you can send unsuspecting users snippets to execute that would transfer funds)

issue.title: Decode error when submitting a proposal for Gov v2.
issue.body: Hello! issue.title: feature request: multi-call function in polkadot.js api by default
issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

<!---

REQUIRED:

Classify the type of report your are submitting

-->

  - [ ] Bug report
  - [x] Feature request
  - [ ] Support request
  - [ ] Other


* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**
  - as far as I know, `api.queryMulti` doesn't support smart-contract interaction.
  - it should be available also with smart contract interaction 

for example, expected behavior would be something like 
```js
const aliceAddress = 'zxx...'
calls = [{
  address: 'zzz....', // contract address which has balanceOf function
  functionName: 'balanceOf',
  args: [aliceAddress]
},
{
  address: 'zxy....', // another contract address which has balanceOf function
  functionName: 'balanceOf',
  args: [aliceAddress]
}
]
const result = await api.queryMulti(calls)
console.log(result) // display the balances of zzz... and zxy.. token
```
c.f: https://github.com/makerdao/multicall

<!---

REQUIRED:

If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen. If you're
suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work.

-->


* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**
  - because most of the multicall would be made with smart contract, it should be supported

<!---

OPTIONAL:

Suggest a motivation for the request or ideas how to implement the
addition or change

-->

comment.body:
It is either -

- custom logic (not mapping to RPCs)
- doing it on the contracts layer (which is what your linked repo does on Ethereum)

It can only go into api-contracts and in all cases it would need to know the ABIs to make actual calls for option 1 (in the case of state, the metadata supplies all interfaces and multi-RPCs, so it can be a single step). Obviously your linked source uses the second option, since you have exactly the same ABI/RPC related issues elsewhere on contract platforms.

issue.title: How to add custom derives?
issue.body:
I was browsing in the codebase, but I could not get a full picture of what one is supposed to do if they want to provide custom derives to their api-augmented object. Documentation is very poor, and everything seems to be so "runtimey" and flexible that it's hard to look at and replicated.
Our use case is the following: given some sort of ID, we want to 1. perform a query to fetch some details, 2. use the information about the block number returned from the query to perform an` api.derive.getBlockByNumber` call, and then retrieve some info from the block and return it from the user.

This ideally would be solved with a `api.derive.credential.fetchById()`, which does all I mentioned above. Otherwise, one has to do `api.query.credentials.fetch()`, and then some more logic that, in the end, calls `api.derive.getBlockByNumber`.

Is there a way to get support in what we want to do?

comment.body:
https://github.com/polkadot-js/api/issues

I would not expect a speedy resolution (unless somebody submits a PR), but at least it gets it into the queue to be done at "some point in the future".

comment.body:
None at all. 

PRs are welcome for [additions/support](https://github.com/polkadot-js/api/tree/master/packages/typegen) if this would be useful. (Alternatively you can log it as an request to get it in the queue)

Is there a way to get support in what we want to do?

comment.body:
Internally the API uses rxjs, and this then gets exposed both rxjs and promise variants of the API. Since derives are "internal interfaces" it fits into the same process, creating them exposes them on all type of APIs.

There is no augmentation for derives.

pull_request.title: Member Request
pull_request.body:
My name is Davide and I started working on the Polkadot ecosystem almost one year ago.

I'm mostly passionate about working on low level system components,
with main focus on applied cryptography and distributed computing.

Since I started working on Substrate and Polkadot my main tasks are more or less related to the consensus protocols components.

---

Worth mentioning contributions to the ecosystem so far:
- https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/pull/2352  - support for ECDSA identities in Rust libp2p implementation
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/10798 - integration of a bit faster secp256k1 ECDSA implementation
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11022 - revert Babe's consensus data on CLI revert command
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11162 - revert Grandpa's consensus data on CLI revert command
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/10748 - remove obsolete Babe's block weight data
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11228 - Mostly a simplification and recursive to iterative rewrite of a fairly important data structure used to keep track of epoch data by both Babe and Grandpa (and next Sassafras).
- https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/5350 - Polkadot chain selection subsystem data revert
- https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/5438 - Polkadot approval voting subsystem data revert

---

But mostly, I use my time to work on Sassafras protocol implementation:
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11678
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11889
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/12314
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/11879 - Main PR (still open - WiP)
- https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/11515 - Main tracking issue

---

Beside that, my daily job is to actively work on the Substrate framework so other, not really worth mentioning, minor contribution pops-up from time to time

---

I apply for **I Dan**
